On 2/6/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
>
> but I wouldn't=
 expect that from seasoned JUnit users, since it's a
> design they know and=
 use.


...  indirectly.

Reflection is used inside JUnit, but you don't ne=
ed to know about it to
write tests, and just because it works fine for JUni=
t and plenty of other
products (application servers, servlet engines, etc..=
.) doesn't mean that
one should forget the dangers associated to its usage.=


Again, the point is that reflection is dangerous, not that it's useless.
